text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we started to see signs of early human culture. For example, we can see this in paintings found in caves. However, no one knows the connection between this new culture and language. Human brains did not suddenly get bigger, but people became more complex and more intelligent. Did using language cause their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start to create language?
